attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
The project will establish an underground hydrogen storage in existing natural gas salt caverns at Lille Torup (DK).
The scope of this project covers repurposing one natural gas cavern into hydrogen in 2027, with a scalable set-up capable of repurposing several other caverns if needed.
The project aims to enable cluster development, as an essential part of the Danish hydrogen infrastructure, in close collaboration with local projects, as well enhance cross border hydrogen import/export, as part of the development of the Danish Hydrogen Backbone West project.
The project has the following technical specifications:
- The first cavern will be able to hold 7,000 tons H2 and have an injection / withdrawal capacity 480 MWh/h (LHV) or 567 MWh/h (HHV).
- Working gas volume is 116 GWh (LHV) or 137 MWh/h (HHV).
- Expected increase in underground hydrogen storage capacity in total 4-5 caverns equal 28-35,000 tons of H2 (the caverns have an average size of 700,000 m3).
attributes.IMPLEMENTATION_STATUS_DESCR: Planned but not yet in permitting
